properties.description:
Grand Daddy Basin Out and Back

Rating: Difficult

Grandaddy Basin is a very popular area in the High Uintas Wilderness due to its proximity to Salt Lake City, its fantastic lakes, and overall gorgeous views. While you might not have the basin to yourself, once you make it past the first few lakes, the number of hikers drops drastically and the landscape offers more solitude.

Ibantik Lake

Rating: Intermediate

A nice day hike on a well defined trail through to several Alpine Lakes.

Ostler Lake

Rating: Intermediate

This is one of the classic backpacking destinations in the High Uintas Wilderness, and makes a great out and back hike.

Bald Mountain Trail

Rating: Intermediate

Bald Mountain is a prominent peak overlooking Bald Mountain Pass, Moosehorn Lake, and Mirror Lake in Wasatch National Forest. This hike in particular makes a steep, rocky, and exposed bid for the summit along the well-marked Bald Mountain Trail and ends with a spectacular view of the surrounding area.

Black Elk

Rating: 5.10a

Black Elk is a good enough reason to drive all the way down the Mirror Lake Hwy and take the 20 min hike to the Ruth Lake Crag. It has an interesting, balancy beginning, followed by a bouldery crux, onto an exposed face. The rock has good friction, the holds are positive, and the pro is place a safe, sane distance.

Up the Irons

Rating: 5.11c

The most popular rated Trad climb on the Iron Hayden Wall.
